Figure 3:Visualization of the Structural Attention Bias.
The plot compares the attention logit bias of the standard decay (λ=0.5\lambda=0.5, gray dashed) versus a hypothetical aggressive decay (λ=0.68\lambda=0.68, red solid). The steeper slope of the hypothetical curve illustrates the stronger penalty required if we were to prioritize conflict resolution over stability; however, our fixed prior (λ=0.5\lambda=0.5) strikes a balanced trade-off, effectively suppressing outdated information on distant history to resolve temporal conflicts.
